description: From French télémètre (“device used for measuring distance”) coined by Selligue from télé- +‎ -mètre, possibly from a blend of télescope and micromètre.

entries.meaning: Any measuring device used in telemetry.
A device used for rangefinding, especially of military targets.

verbs.description: telemeter (third-person singular simple present telemeters, present participle telemetering, simple past and past participle telemetered)
